org.jcatapult.persistence
Interface TransactionResultProcessor<T>

All Known Implementing Classes:
DefaultTransactionResultProcessor
public interface TransactionResultProcessor<T>

This interface can be implemented and passed to the Transactional annotation. This is useful for determining based on an exception that is thrown or the return value of a method if the transaction should be rolled back.

Method Summary
 boolean rollback(T result, Throwable throwable)
          Determines if the transaction should be rolled back based on the return value of a method invocation or the exception that the method threw.
 

Method Detail

rollback

boolean rollback(T result,
                 Throwable throwable)
Determines if the transaction should be rolled back based on the return value of a method invocation or the exception that the method threw.

Parameters:
result - The return value of a method. This could be null of void methods.
throwable - The exception thrown from the method. This will be null if the method invoked didn't throw an exception.
Returns:
True if the transaction should be rolled back, false otherwise.
